show up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to arrive, especially at the place where someone is waiting for you
show up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Seth showed up, apologising for being late.
We had 200 people show up for our seminar.
show up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to make it possible to see or notice something that was not clear before
show up.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The sunlight showed up the marks on the window.
show up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to be easy to see or notice
show up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Use a light colour which will show up on a dark background.
show up.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to make someone feel embarrassed by behaving in a stupid or unacceptable way when you are with them
show up.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: She says I showed her up in front of her friends when they came to the house.
